name: NETXP EQL Kernel Panic detected
description: This rule is designed to monitor system logs for occurrences of kernel panics, which are critical events that can impact the stability and security of the system. When triggered, the rule generates an alert to notify administrators or security personnel about the presence of a kernel panic. The rule focuses on specific keywords and patterns commonly associated with kernel panic log entries.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
event where message: "*Kernel panic*" and message: "*not syncing*" and host.os.type: "linux" and event.dataset: "system.syslog" 
//and host.ip in ("0.0.0.0/8") - w przypadku systemow krytyczynych
